item.title: LF Mentorship Session
item.description: Notes from LF Live Mentorship Session: Best Practices for Getting Your Patches Accepted During this mentorship session, several key takeaways and resources were shared for those interested in contributing to the Linux kernel. Below are some important notes and helpful links to get started. Key Tips for Getting Started: Watch Mailing Lists It’s crucial to start by observing mailing lists related to your areas of interest. This allows you to understand the discussions and ongoing work within the community.

item.title: Free Learning Resources
item.description: Many publishers are temporarily providing free access to eBooks/slides/videos and other eContent during the COVID-19 crisis. I’ve arranged some of them I like. Please find below. Security, Pentesing, InfoSec - Web Link Exploit Development - Web Link Total OSCP Guide - Web Link Creating a Rootkit to Learn C - Web Link The TCP/IP Guide - Web Link Advanced SQL and database books and resources - Web Link Syncfusion - software development, data visualization, and data science - Web Link Mastering Embedded Linux - Blog Series - Web Link Course materials for Modern Binary Exploitation by RPISEC - Web Link OSCP Human Guide - Web Link Learn Regex by Examples - Web Link Mastering GNU Awk - Web Link Javascript Info - Web Link Malware Analysis course at University of Cincinnati, Jan 2020-Apr 2020 - Web Link Teach Yourself Computer Science - Web Link Deep Dive Into Modern Web Development - Web Link Malware Analysis Traning - Web Link Hundreds of freely accessible courses from METU - Web Link Computer Engineering - Web Link C Homework Collection - Very Best - Web Link Data Structure - Very Best - Web Link Awesome Reverse Engineering - Web Link Algorithm 101 from MIT - Web Link - Exams and Solutions C/C++ Books - Web Link

Hi, I’m Samet! I’m a Senior Software Engineer based in California, with extensive experience in wireless technology and embedded systems. Currently, I’m part of the wireless roaming team at Panasonic Avionics, where I focus on developing solutions that enhance the connectivity experience for passengers globally. Before joining Panasonic, I worked at DZS (formerly ASSIA Inc.) from October 2021 to February 2024. During that time, I contributed to integrating the DZS Edge Solution into embedded Linux wireless devices.
